Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (partly fired red); part of lotus bud in faded added white outline with faded added red centre followed by two concentric white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of female figure (head and lower body missing; with added red on chiton and dotted paryphe), to right and holding up pomegranate in her right hand and extending her left hand towards a komast’s right arm.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the Group of Worshippers. According to her, a komos scene is depicted. The leading vase from this group is the St Petersburg chalice from Berezan (Lemos 1991, no. 964). Most of the vases in this group display a mixture of techniques consisting of portraying female figures in outline and dancing komasts in black figure.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 126, p. 128, fig. 70, p. 131, p. 291, no. 896, pl. 120)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1014) (phase 2)
